text: System - Default Folder on Disk: N/A - Special process for running kernel threads, ntoskrnl.exe, and drivers.
Idle - Default Folder on Disk: N/A - Special process for idle threads.
smss.exe - Default Folder on Disk: %SystemRoot%\System32\ - Session Manager Subsystem. 1 persistent master instance, child instances spawn and exit per session.
csrss.exe - Default Folder on Disk: %SystemRoot%\System32\ - Client/Server Runtime Subsystem. 2 or more instances are normal (two near boot time and others as new users log on).
wininit.exe - Default Folder on Disk: %SystemRoot%\System32\ - Windows initialization process for Session 0 (Services). One instance will be present.
lsass.exe - Default Folder on Disk: %SystemRoot%\System32\ - One instance will be present (if Credential Guard is enabled, lsaiso.exe will also be created).
services.exe - Default Folder on Disk: %SystemRoot%\System32\ - Service Control Manager. One instance will be present.

svchost.exe - Default Folder on Disk: %SystemRoot%\System32\ - A service host process to host services implemented in DLLs. Multiple instances are normal. Note that the service being hosted can still be malicious even if the svchost.exe process itself is legitimate.

taskhost.exe, taskhostex.exe or taskhostw.exe - Default Folder on Disk: %SystemRoot%\System32\ - Called taskhost.exe in Windows 7, taskhostex.exe in Windows 8 and taskhostw.exe in Windows 10. One or more instances is normal, but only with the name appropriate to your Windows version.
winlogon.exe - Default Folder on Disk: %SystemRoot%\System32\ - One or more instances are normal depending on number of interactive users (Session 1 and above).
explorer.exe - Default Folder on Disk: %SystemRoot%\ - One per interactive logon.
Registry - Default Folder on Disk: N/A - New to Windows 10. Special process to store registry hives in memory.
Memory Compression (MemCompression) - Default Folder on Disk: N/A - Part of the Windows memory compression feature.
RuntimeBroker.exe - Default Folder on Disk: %SystemRoot%\System32\ - One or more instances are normal depending on number of Universal Windows Platform apps open. Windows 8 and later.
dwm.exe - Default Folder on Disk: %SystemRoot%\System32\ - Desktop Windows Manager, one instance per interactive user logged on.
dllhost.exe - Default Folder on Disk: %SystemRoot%\System32\ - A COM surrogate process. May appear in zero to multiple instances to host COM objects implemented as DLLs.

Default Windows Process Tree: System is the root process with three children: Registry, smss.exe, and MemCompression. smss.exe spawns child smss.exe instances that exit after creating session processes. For Session 0: smss.exe spawns csrss.exe and wininit.exe. wininit.exe spawns lsass.exe and services.exe. services.exe spawns svchost.exe instances. For user sessions: smss.exe spawns csrss.exe and winlogon.exe. winlogon.exe spawns userinit.exe (which exits) and dwm.exe. userinit.exe spawns explorer.exe.
